title: 111_hr1943
content: The "Tax Equity Act of 2009" is the short title of this Act. It includes regional cost-of-living adjustments in individual income tax rates. The "Tax Equity Act of 2009" includes regional cost-of-living adjustments in individual income tax rates, where the rate table is further adjusted based on minimum and maximum dollar amounts for each rate bracket. The Tax Equity Act of 2009 incorporates regional cost-of-living adjustments in individual income tax rates. Rate brackets are multiplied by applicable multipliers based on the statistical area of the individual's primary residence. Rate brackets are adjusted as necessary, and any amount not a multiple of $50 is rounded to the nearest multiple of $50. The Secretary determines multipliers annually by December 15. The Tax Equity Act of 2009 incorporates regional cost-of-living adjustments in individual income tax rates. The Secretary determines applicable multipliers for statistical areas annually by December 15. Multipliers are based on cost-of-living differentials, with adjustments made to ensure rate brackets are rounded to the nearest multiple of $50. The Tax Equity Act of 2009 includes cost-of-living adjustments in income tax rates based on statistical areas. Multipliers are determined annually by the Secretary of Labor, with adjustments to ensure rate brackets are rounded to the nearest multiple of $50. The cost-of-living differential for each area is calculated by dividing the area's cost-of-living by the average cost-of-living for the United States. The Secretary of Labor determines and publishes a cost-of-living index for statistical areas annually based on market prices. The index is calculated using the same methodology as the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers. The amendment made by this section applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2009, with a transition rule for 2010. The area applicable multiplier outside the United States is 1.
